_header: Unto the holy and undivided Trinity
Note: Preceded by Latin prose, ‘Sancte & Indiuidue trinitati Ihesu cristi…’ of which it is a translation; follows 1534 and 860.
Subjects: translations; epilogues; prayers, to Virgin Mary; Virgin Mary, prayers to
_description: Balade added by Caxton to be said by those pleased with the Lyfe of Our Lady which precedes it in the printed book — one stanza rhyme royal

Chetham6709.First Lines:
Vnto the holy and undevidid TryntyteThre persones In one veray
                    godhede…
Chetham6709.Last Lines:
…Of every Creature whatsomeuer he beWorlde withowte end Amen
                    say all we
Chetham6709.Attributed Title:
Benedictum sit dulcissime Nomen Ihu x / Gloriosissime matris eius Marie
                        Ineternum / et Vltra Nos cum prole pia benedicat virgo Maria / Amen (f.
                        158v)
